skill.name: content-research-writer
skill.description: Assists in writing high-quality content by conducting research, adding citations, improving hooks, iterating on outlines, and providing real-time feedback on each section. Transforms your writing process from solo effort to collaborative partnership.
skill.summary: Writing partner that helps research, outline, draft, and refine content while maintaining your unique voice.
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation with writing workflows and examples. All 43 static findings are false positives: the weak cryptography patterns match markdown formatting, the external command patterns are documentation examples in code blocks showing mkdir and cd commands, and the network pattern is the expected GitHub source URL. No executable code present.

content.user_title: Research and write high-quality content with AI assistance
content.value_statement: Writing quality content requires research, structure, and continuous refinement. This skill acts as your collaborative writing partner, helping you outline ideas, conduct research with proper citations, improve hooks and introductions, and get real-time feedback on each section while preserving your unique voice.
actual_capabilities: Create structured outlines for articles, blog posts, and technical content
Provide section-by-section feedback on clarity, flow, and style
Suggest multiple hook alternatives with explanations of why each works
Help organize citations in various formats including inline, numbered, and footnote styles
Maintain consistent tone and voice matching your writing style
Conduct comprehensive final reviews checking structure, content quality, and readability
limitations: Cannot access external websites or databases for real-time research
Does not automatically verify the accuracy of citations or sources
Requires user to provide research materials or web content for citation
Cannot directly edit files without user confirmation of suggested changes

use_cases.title: Blog Post Writing
use_cases.description: Create well-structured blog posts with strong hooks, clear sections, and proper citations. Get feedback on each section as you write to maintain flow and readability.

use_cases.title: Technical Documentation
use_cases.description: Write clear technical tutorials and documentation with step-by-step instructions, code examples, and troubleshooting sections. Ensure accuracy and completeness through iterative review.

use_cases.title: Thought Leadership Articles
use_cases.description: Develop unique perspectives on industry topics with strong thesis statements, supporting evidence, and compelling conclusions. Research existing viewpoints to differentiate your angle.
use_cases.target_user: Business leaders and subject matter experts

prompt_templates.title: Create an Outline
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an outline for an article about [topic]. The target audience is [audience] and I want to [educate/persuade/explain].
prompt_templates.scenario: Starting a new writing project and need structure

prompt_templates.title: Improve My Hook
prompt_templates.prompt: Here is my introduction: [paste introduction]. Help me make the hook more compelling for [target audience].
prompt_templates.scenario: Have a draft introduction but opening feels weak

prompt_templates.title: Get Section Feedback
prompt_templates.prompt: I just finished the [section name] section: [paste content]. Review it for clarity, flow, and style. Does it match my voice?
prompt_templates.scenario: Completed a section and want feedback before continuing

prompt_templates.title: Full Draft Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my complete draft for structure, flow, content quality, and readability. Check that all claims are supported and citations are complete: [paste full draft].
prompt_templates.scenario: Finished writing and ready for comprehensive feedback

output_examples.input: Help me create an outline for an article about AI productivity tools for product managers.
output_examples.output:
I created a structured outline with:
- Hook section exploring the PM time management challenge
- Introduction covering the AI productivity landscape
- Three main sections: Research Synthesis Tools, Prioritization Assistants, and Stakeholder Communication
- Conclusion with implementation roadmap
- Research to-do list identifying needed data points and citations

The outline includes specific prompts for where examples and data will strengthen each section.

output_examples.input: Review my introduction and suggest better hooks.
output_examples.output:
Your current hook is clear but could be more engaging. I analyzed three alternatives:

Option 1 (Personal Story): Opens with a specific PM struggling with 200 unread customer interviews
Why it works: Creates immediate empathy and illustrates the core problem

Option 2 (Surprising Data): Leads with statistic that PMs spend 60% of time on information synthesis
Why it works: Quantifies the pain point and builds urgency

Option 3 (Bold Question): Asks what if you could talk to every customer before morning coffee
Why it works: Paints an aspirational picture of the solution

All three create curiosity and promise value to your PM audience.

best_practices: Work on one section at a time and request feedback before moving forward to maintain quality and flow throughout the piece
Share examples of your previous writing early so the AI can learn and match your unique voice and tone preferences
Keep research and citations in a separate file to maintain organization and make it easy to verify sources later
anti_patterns: Writing the entire draft before asking for any feedback, which makes it harder to fix structural issues or flow problems
Accepting all suggestions without considering if they match your voice, which can make the writing feel generic or inconsistent
Skipping the outline phase and jumping straight to writing, which often leads to disorganized content and unclear arguments

faq.question: Can this skill search the web for research?
faq.answer: No, this skill cannot access external websites. You need to provide research materials, paste web content, or describe findings you want included. The skill helps organize and format that information with proper citations.

faq.question: Will this skill write in my voice or sound generic?
faq.answer: The skill learns your style from examples you share and adjusts tone based on your feedback. It offers suggestions rather than replacements, allowing you to choose what matches your voice. You maintain full control over the final content.

faq.question: What citation formats are supported?
faq.answer: The skill can format citations in multiple styles including inline parenthetical, numbered references, and footnote style. Specify your preferred format and it will maintain consistency throughout your document.

faq.question: Can I use this for technical documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works well for technical content including tutorials, API documentation, and how-to guides. It can help structure code examples, add explanations, and create troubleshooting sections while maintaining technical accuracy.

faq.question: How should I organize my writing files?
faq.answer: Create a dedicated folder for each article with separate files for outline, research, draft versions, and final copy. This organization makes it easier to track progress, maintain citations, and iterate on your content.

faq.question: Does this replace human editing?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides AI-assisted feedback and suggestions during the writing process. For publication-quality content, you should still consider professional editing, especially for high-stakes writing like books, academic papers, or official communications.
